text: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am the architect of my life; I build its foundation and choose its contents.
author: Affirmation

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: My potential to succeed is infinite.
author: Affirmation

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: I am worthy of success and happiness.
author: Affirmation

text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I embrace challenges as opportunities for growth.
author: Affirmation

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: I possess the strength and resilience to overcome any obstacle.
author: Affirmation

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: My mind is filled with positive and nourishing thoughts.
author: Affirmation

text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am calm, confident, and in control of my emotions.
author: Affirmation

text: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.
author: Seneca

text: I attract abundance and prosperity into my life.
author: Affirmation

text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you.
author: Epictetus

text: I am grateful for all the blessings in my life.
author: Affirmation

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I release all doubt and welcome faith.
author: Affirmation

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: I am surrounded by love and support.
author: Affirmation

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: I trust my intuition and make wise decisions.
author: Affirmation

text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am at peace with my past and excited about my future.
author: Affirmation

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: I forgive myself and others, releasing all negativity.
author: Affirmation

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

text: My body is healthy, my mind is brilliant, my soul is tranquil.
author: Affirmation

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I radiate positive energy and attract positive experiences.
author: Affirmation

text: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
author: Seneca

text: I am creative, resourceful, and full of brilliant ideas.
author: Affirmation

text: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
author: Epictetus

text: I am confident in my abilities and talents.
author: Affirmation

text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am a magnet for miracles.
author: Affirmation

text: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
author: Seneca

text: I am aligned with my purpose and passion.
author: Affirmation

text: Curb your desire—don’t set your heart on so many things and you will get what you need.
author: Epictetus

text: I treat myself with kindness and respect.
author: Affirmation

text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am open to receiving all the good life has to offer.
author: Affirmation

text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
author: Seneca

text: I am strong, healthy, and full of energy.
author: Affirmation

text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

text: I find joy and pleasure in the simple things in life.
author: Affirmation

text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am a powerful creator. I create the life I want.
author: Affirmation

text: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

text: I am worthy of unconditional love.
author: Affirmation

text: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
author: Epictetus

text: I am exactly where I need to be.
author: Affirmation

text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I trust the process of life.
author: Affirmation

text: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
author: Seneca

text: I am a beacon of light and positivity.
author: Affirmation

text: People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.
author: Epictetus

text: I choose thoughts that empower me.
author: Affirmation

text: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am in control of my thoughts, feelings, and actions.
author: Affirmation

text: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
author: Seneca

text: I am proud of who I am and who I am becoming.
author: Affirmation

text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
author: Epictetus

text: I honor my commitments to myself.
author: Affirmation

text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I let go of what no longer serves me.
author: Affirmation

text: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms—you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.
author: Seneca

text: I am constantly learning and evolving.
author: Affirmation

text: Small-minded people blame others. Average people blame themselves. The wise see all blame as foolishness.
author: Epictetus

text: My life is a beautiful adventure.
author: Affirmation

text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

text: I am worthy of my dreams.
author: Affirmation

text: Do not indulge in dreams of having what you have not, but reckon up the chief of the blessings you do possess.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am enough.
author: Affirmation

text: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
author: Seneca

text: I am focused on my goals and I will achieve them.
author: Affirmation

text: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
author: Epictetus

text: I embrace my uniqueness.
author: Affirmation

text: It is in your power to withdraw yourself whenever you desire. Perfect tranquility within consists in the good ordering of the mind.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I attract positive people into my life.
author: Affirmation

text: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.
author: Seneca

text: I am a loving and kind person.
author: Affirmation

text: Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior, regardless of what other people think or do.
author: Epictetus

text: I deserve to be happy and loved.
author: Affirmation

text: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself.
author: Plato

text: My possibilities are endless.
author: Affirmation

text: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
author: Plato

text: I am grateful for this present moment.
author: Affirmation

text: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

text: My life is filled with joy and abundance.
author: Affirmation

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: I am a positive influence on others.
author: Affirmation

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

text: I celebrate my accomplishments and learn from my setbacks.
author: Affirmation

text: The mind is everything; what you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: I am creating the life of my dreams.
author: Affirmation

text: He who is brave is free.
author: Seneca

text: My thoughts are my reality.
author: Affirmation

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: I am capable of overcoming any challenge.
author: Affirmation

text: The obstacle in the path becomes the path. Never forget, within every obstacle is an opportunity to improve our condition.
author: Ryan Holiday

text: I am becoming a better version of myself every day.
author: Affirmation

text: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am deserving of peace and tranquility.
author: Affirmation

text: All that exists is but a part of thee.
author: Seneca

text: I am a source of good in the world.
author: Affirmation

text: Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of one's desires, but by the removal of desire.
author: Epictetus

text: I am confident in my decisions.
author: Affirmation

text: The world is change, and life is opinion.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am open to new possibilities.
author: Affirmation

text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
author: Seneca

text: I am a person of action.
author: Affirmation

text: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
author: Epictetus

text: I am living a life of purpose.
author: Affirmation

text: Receive without conceit, release without struggle.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am a beacon of love.
author: Affirmation

text: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.
author: Seneca

text: I am a work in progress.
author: Affirmation

text: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

text: I am a student of life.
author: Affirmation

text: To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
author: Zen Proverb

text: I am at peace.
author: Affirmation

text: The root of suffering is attachment.
author: Buddha

text: I am free from the past.
author: Affirmation

text: Life is a journey, not a destination.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I am living in the present moment.
author: Affirmation

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: I am a creator of my own destiny.
author: Affirmation

text: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I am a vessel of creativity.
author: Affirmation

text: He who is not a good servant will not be a good master.
author: Plato

text: I am the master of my fate.
author: Affirmation

text: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

text: I am an agent of change.
author: Affirmation

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: I am making a difference.
author: Affirmation

text: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I am an inspiration to others.
author: Affirmation

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I am loved.
author: Affirmation

text: He who is contented is rich.
author: Lao Tzu

text: I am content.
author: Affirmation

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I am resilient.
author: Affirmation

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: I am passionate about my work.
author: Affirmation

text: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I am a victor, not a victim.
author: Affirmation

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I am living my life to the fullest.
author: Affirmation

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: I am present.
author: Affirmation

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: I am alive.
author: Affirmation

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: I am happy.
author: Affirmation

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: I am simple.
author: Affirmation

text: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: I am living.
author: Affirmation

text: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: My life is a fairy tale.
author: Affirmation

text: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I am playful.
author: Affirmation

text: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: I am loved and knowledgeable.
author: Affirmation

text: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: James M. Barrie

text: I am humble.
author: Affirmation

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: I am persistent.
author: Affirmation

text: Life is like a coin. You can spend it any way you wish, but you only spend it once.
author: Lillian Dickson

text: I am intentional.
author: Affirmation

text: The big lesson in life, baby, is never be scared of anyone or anything.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: I am fearless.
author: Affirmation
